creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: Japanese street at night with shops at left; red lanterns on shops; woman in purple kimono in LRQ; figures in silhouette on street at right; another woman in a pale purple kimono at left at shop counter
inscription: Left: [一九五一年作　瓢六] {1951nen saku, ?????}; bottom, in grey: [Hyoroku], in pencil: [Toshi Yoshida]
medium: Woodblock print; ink and colors on paper
title: Hyōroku
